radiographic_examinations.findings: Findings suggestive of congenital lobar emphysema of the right upper lobe.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: contrast-enhanced computed tomography (CT) of the chest
radiographic_examinations.findings: Hyperinflation of the lungs with severe confluent emphysema and multiple apical bullae; normal postsurgical findings including a stump from right upper lobectomy and coil from embolization of a patent ductus arteriosus; enlarged main pulmonary artery measuring 3.8 cm in diameter.

Dilatation of the right atrium, right ventricle, and inferior vena cava; estimated right ventricular systolic pressure of 65 mm Hg; aortic valve abnormality with moderate aortic regurgitation not present on past echocardiograms.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Findings suggestive of constrictive pericarditis, including a septal bounce and respiratory variation across the mitral valve, were observed.
